pros: Very nice and cooperative atmosphere
cons: Clinical responsibilities limit the time for efficient scientific research

pros: Great research atmosphere at MHH
cons: Great work is conducted there

pros: There are many offers on the homepage career board, for part-time or full-time jobs. Easy to see.
cons: Very few permanent positions or high-level positions opening online.

pros: You get flexible working hours
cons: It does not feel like as a very open minded environment

review_title: Nice PI, difficult to get funding
pros: The PI was very nice and there were flexible hours
cons: The technological infrastructure for research was lacking. There were limited opportunities for advancement in research

pros: International environment where you will meet people from all around the world. In general they have more money than in other european countries. And the phD program has classes and aside activities that are very enriching
cons: PhD students work a lot, most of the times you dont have weekends. And you go back home pretty late plus there is a lot of pressure

pros: good workin envieronment family freindly
cons: not so much oportunity for future carrier

pros: Flexibility, creativity, good salary, friendly environment, good scientific practice
cons: not permanent, no growing opportunities,

pros: Well connected to other institutions
cons: Could be quite competitive (internally)

pros: Good reputation, good opportunities for clinical research
cons: Hospital environment is not great for collaborative PhD atmosphere.

review_title: MHH is a good place for PhD
pros: MHH has a big scientific community
cons: Obligatory lectures in the PhD program are often not interesting

pros: Flexibility with home office. option
cons: Heavy bureaucracy and hierarchy. Some incompetent staff at human resources.

review_title: International working environment and structured program
pros: Internationality of the program is great. Recruitment is world-wide and based on merit.
cons: PhD salary is expected not to be high but calculated towards living costs. The training is excellent though

pros: supportive the students' development in general
cons: Too much birocreaucy which can be hard to detangle

pros: we have flexible working hours
cons: there is no planning and no supervision

review_title: Nothing International about it, NOT an 'academic research' oriented place.
pros: Well supported by Research Funds. Good infrastructure of both the research institutes and hospital. Well-paying jobs. Systematic and well-organized. Low cost of living- you save quite a bit!
cons: Though the PhD programs are called 'International', there isn't much of an international mix. Almost all of the administrative, professional and research work is conducted in German. A very quite place if you choose to stay within the campus of the MHH itself. No student unions, PhD counsellors/counselling committee. Very limited social life. Lacks the feel of working in an academic/university setting (if that is what you're looking for). Only the two fine ladies working in the International office are particularly helpful and kind.

review_title: Good university research, but lousy salary for scientists...
pros: Work / life balance is good, needed to work not later than 6 p.m. - mostly not bound to deadlines, freedom to do research on topics you are interested in.
cons: Bad salary, particularly for scientists. Salary for physicians is good, but they are working in clinic as well. Salary for scientists is bound to "Tarifvertrag". Every industrial company will obviously pay more...

pros: there are lot of researchers in mhh which makes it easy to set up new collaborations, good infrastructure, as a student you can practise lot of sports for free, the gym is nice, Hannover is inexpensive,
cons: Hannover is a little boring, some staff do not speak english.

review_title: Less innovative, but functional & stable research sectors
pros: If you don't like change, you will like it there!
cons: No chance of career development for women; excessive office politics; poor management;

pros: I work in the department of Psychiatry. Its an exciting place to work with challanging projects revolving around understanding the emchanisms as well as developing biomarkers for Diagnosing Psychiatric disorders
cons: Lack of efficient coordination between lab and clinics

review_title: Things can change a lot between diff. departments
pros: Good working atmosphere and good funding (depending on the working group).
cons:
Terrible working atmosphere (depending on the working group). 
The city of Hannover is overall a bit uninteresting.

pros:
You learn to be independent. 
A place for clinical research.
cons:
You are all by yourself. 
The research is more clinic oriented.

review_title: Great place to complete a PhD
pros: Great Labs, Great Hospital, Collaborative Component
cons: No major downside, experience depends on supervisor.

pros: Nice place to work and well-equipped place to do research
cons: not easy to get permanent position

cons: the salary is pretty low
